metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21688 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-use-after-free in the av_freep function in libavutil/mem.c of FFmpeg4.2 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1').
vice package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
